message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI

Reasoning: The paper discusses the performance of different models for feature representation of text documents in the context of document classification. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories in computer science, including Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Computational Linguistics (cs.CL), Machine Learning (cs.LG), Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). However, since the focus is on document classification, we can eliminate cs.SI as it is more focused on network analysis. Among the remaining four sub-categories, cs.IR and cs.CL are the most likely as they deal with text processing and information retrieval. cs.LG and cs.AI are also relevant as they deal with machine learning and artificial intelligence, which are used in the document classification task.
